PHASE SUMMARY — Noirtier — middle

Role: Noirtier's role in this phase is that of a grandfather who is observing and reacting to the conversation between his granddaughter Valentine and her lover Maximilian.

Traits: Noirtier is described as having a "paralyzed frame" and being the only person capable of discerning emotion in him. He is also shown to be agitated during the conversation.

Relationships: Noirtier has a relationship with his granddaughter Valentine, who is the only person capable of discerning emotion in him. He also has a relationship with his son, Villefort, who is mentioned in the conversation.

Notable behaviors: Noirtier's notable behavior in this phase is his agitation during the conversation, which is observed by Valentine.
